qas.question: When did the Karabakh War end?

answers.text: Organisation for Security and Co-operation in Europe

qas.question: Armenia has closed borders with which two countries?
How many people died as a result of the fighting betwen Armenia and Azerbaijan?
Who gained the most from the Karabakh War?

context: The Karabakh war ended after a Russian-brokered cease-fire was put in place in <a0_0>1994<a0_0/>. The war was a success for the <a4_0>Karabakh Armenian forces<a4_0/> who managed to capture 16% of Azerbaijan's internationally recognised territory including Nagorno-Karabakh itself. Since then, Armenia and Azerbaijan have held peace talks, mediated by the <a1_0>Organisation for Security and Co-operation in Europe<a1_0/> (OSCE). The status of Karabakh has yet to be determined. The economies of both countries have been hurt in the absence of a complete resolution and Armenia's borders with <a2_0>Turkey and Azerbaijan<a2_0/> remain closed. By the time both Azerbaijan and Armenia had finally agreed to a ceasefire in 1994, an estimated <a3_0>30,000<a3_0/> people had been killed and over a million had been displaced.
